content: I've been meaning to try out astrophotography, so I set up my tripod and camera in my backyard last Saturday night to capture some shots of the Milky Way. It was a bit tricky to get the focus right, but I managed to snag a few decent photos. I need to work on reducing the noise and improving the overall quality, but it was a great learning experience. Do you have any tips on how to improve my astrophotography skills, especially when it comes to focusing and noise reduction?
